funding_code: LAMP VALUE ADDED PRODUCER GRANT MANDATORY
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Big West Management LLC with processing costs, overhead, and administrative expenses. Big West Management is a husband and wife business that raises cattle and, through processing, the animal carcasses are changed into quality packaged beef.

naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Wired Wild West Inc., doing business as Farmers on Flynn, to complete administrative and marketing tasks. Farmers on Flynn is a husband and wife business that offers year round fresh produce which is both local and sustainable.

funding_code: RBCS OPPORTUNITY NATIVE AMERICAN GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: The Rural Development investment will be used to assist Plenty Doors Community Development Corporation to finance the preparation of a business incubator feasibility study and a leakage study on the Crow Agency, just south of Billings, Mont. in Big Horn County. The business incubator will be designed to accelerate the successful development of entrepreneurial companies on the Crow Reservation. The leakage study will analyze where the dollar leakages are and identify opportunities for shoring these up. This will determine the most promising markets for new and/or expanding local businesses and the best initiatives to support economic development. The Crow Reservation is home to over 14,000 Crow enrolled tribal members and contains about 2,282,000 acres of land within its exterior boundary. There are about 1,511,975 acres of tribal and allotted surface trust acreage.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to pay for a marketing and value-added product refinement; labeling creation branding and printing fees, beef product processing and packaging expenses, marketing for packaged beef campaign and support staff compensation. JWK Enterprises LLC is a small agricultural business in Big Horn, Montana, owned and operated by William and Justine Kougl. Currently, Big Horn County has a population of 26 percent living below the poverty level and William and Justinepride themselves on providing quality, local beef to neighbors and surrounding communities in quantities to fit any budget and freezer size.

funding_code: LAMP VALUE ADDED PRODUCER GRANT MANDATORY
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand the customer base and enhance profitability of Aaron Toews feed mill business from a current processing level of 792 tons of feed per year to 3,120 tons annually, within the three year grant period. The Toews Family Farm is near the small rural community of Hardin, Montana, which is located just north of the Crow Indian Reservation. They started farming in 2011, and in 2019 expanded into milling feed for other farmers. The grant will provide the working capital necessary to purchase required ingredients that supplant the corn that they mill from their own farm and allow Aaron to reduce over-the-road trucking time. The Toews are passionate about running a sustainable family farm are excited to explore expanding their production of non-genetically modified crops.

funding_code: VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER DVLP GRANTS-DISCR
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand customer base and enhance profitability of Montana Prime Meats LLCs beef business. Montana Prime Meats is poised to incrementally expand processing its own animals, as well as some purchased animals, to ensure year-round beef supplies. The grant will allow them to hire a new marketing manager and enable them to expand from a base of 15 head annually to 80 head annually within the three year grant period. Montana Prime Meats LLC is a small beef producer in Fort Smith, Montana, which had a population of 161 in the 2010 census and is located in the persistent poverty county of Big Horn.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
naics_description: OTHER FIRE/RESCUE & PUBLIC SAFETY RELATED SERVICES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for the City of Hardin Police Department to purchase office equipment needed to outfit the space for five new employees. Additionally, grant funds will be used to purchase a variety of software to help this rural police department, which is located in Hardin, Montana, approximately 50 miles east of Billings, manage records, data coding and mapping necessary to complete their public safety missions.

funding_code: NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES COMMUNITY FACILITY GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
naics_description: COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL MACHINERY AND EQUIPMENT (EXCEPT AUTOMOTIVE AND ELECTRONIC) REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase grader equipment for agricultural purposes for the Little Big Horn Community College. Little Big Horn Community College is located on the Crow Agency Reservation, which is also located within rural Big Horn County. The College is a non-profit organization established with the purpose of providing quality educational programs together with culturally oriented educational opportunities for residents of the Crow Agency Reservation. The College is located within a rural area and was chartered in 1984. The project will benefit an average of 261 enrolled students. Rural Development funds along with local funds will be used to assist the college in improving the conditions of the campus.

funding_code: RBCS DEVELOPMENT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funding for a FEMA levee accreditation assessment study to benefit Blaine County, Montana. This county, which lies approximately 150 miles northeast of Helena, has been designated by FEMA to be in a flood zone due to an aged levee within the Milk River Watershed. The levee accreditation study, which is part of the larger Blaine County Floodplain Mapping Project, should provide FEMA the certification needed to ensure this infrastructure is sound, thereby eliminating the flood zoning concerns and, consequentially, lowering insurance rates and preserving businesses and jobs.

funding_code: NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES COMMUNITY FACILITY GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
naics_description: ALL OTHER MISCELLANEOUS SCHOOLS AND INSTRUCTION
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to upgrade the equipment at the radio station operated by Aaniiih Nakoda College, which is located on the Fort Belknap Indian Reservation in Harlem, Montana. The radio station reaches both the campus and surrounding areas. Funds will be used to purchase and install a new FM transmitter with full electrical surge protection. Other equipment installed will include two HVAC units to maintain proper temperatures.

borrower_name: BEARTOOTH RESOURCE CONSERVATION & DEVELOPMENT AREA, INC.
funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for to provide technical assistance to Big Horn County. The technical assistance is for Beartooth Resource Conservation and Development Area Inc. to assist the newly hired economic developer for Big Horn County to build the capacity to successfully launch and sustain this economic, community development and housing position. This will include collaboration with the City of Hardin, the Town of Lodge Grass, and other stakeholders across the county, including Plenty Doors Community Development Corporation located in Crow Agency. This technical assistance will allow for development of robust and sustainable community facilities, housing, and economic development programs throughout Big Horn County and the Crow Indian Reservation.

funding_code: SMALL SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCER GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Information (51)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be utilized to assist Montana Cooperative Development Center, a non-profit organization, in funding technical assistance for finding working solutions on food distribution and food sovereignty for Montanas vulnerable communities. They plan to build in-depth business plans that will identify the components of regional food distribution networks, as well as points of entry and will identify owner-member and steering committee members as well as means of capitalization for regional food networks.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help McCafferty Ranch Company, Inc. expand their sales of all-natural grass-fed beef to include online sales. Joel and Cindy McCafferty run a cow and calf operation in Belt, Montana that adds value to the raw commodity through a hydroponic plant which enables them to grow sprout-finished grass fodder to feed the cattle. With this feeding mechanism, they are able to process beef year-round and provide the consumer beef in quarters, halves or whole.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Greg Rugland purchase and install a 10 kilowatts (kW) solar photovoltaic (PV) system that will be ground-mounted on his ranch. This project is expected to realize $282 in annual energy savings and will replace/save 2,348 kilowatt hours (kWh) of electricity per year.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Farmerlicious Inc., a female majority-owned and operated farm fund the research, product development, test marketing, and distribution of an organic lentil snack mix to be sold online. The owners, Donna Cook and her husband Richard, are multi-generation farmers in Big Sandy, Montana, which is in Chouteau County. The pandemic forced the Cooks to look at other ways to sell their surplus organic black lentils when their main buyer was forced to close operations and they will use this grant to determine the feasibility of an organic snack mix.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) SEARCH GRANTS WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop an environmental report and preliminary engineering report for the town of Geraldine, Mont., which is approximately 70 miles east of Great Falls. The PER will identify deficiencies, potential solutions, and funding options as a first step in determining the appropriate project and methods for updating Geraldines aging water system. The towns water system currently serves 115 residential users and 23 nonresidential users.

funding_code: CF 2019 DISASTER GRANT - TORNADOES FLOODS OTHER
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to add an additional 7,600 square feet to the existing fire hall in Custer County, which lies about 160 miles east of Billings, Mont. Construction includes expanding the current fire hall by 3,600 sq. ft. so all fire tenders and equipment can be housed indoors in heated storage bays. An additional 4,000 square feet will be added to the existing structure and used to house Custer County transportation vehicles in heated storage bays. The 4,000 sq. ft. addition will also include a shared wash bay and conference/meeting room which will be shared by Custer Countys fire and transportation departments. ADA restrooms will also be built.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to help purchase equipment to lease to Jenaries Baked Goods, which is located in an historic building in the central business district of Anaconda, MT, which is approximately 25 miles west of Butte. The business currently operates a bakery and diner in half of building and has opportunity to expand the business to provide a candy shop and ice cream store for more than 9,000 residents of this rural community. funding_code: MAND.ENERGY EFFIC IMPROV GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Webber Holding LLC develop renewable energy systems and make energy-efficiency improvements which will have a direct benefit to the communities of Fallon County, Montana. Located in Eastern Montana, and bordering North Dakota, Fallon County has about 2,900 residents who live in the city of Baker and the town of Plevna, which encompass Fallon Countys 1,619 square mile vicinity. Webber Holding LLC leases business space to Baker Drug LLC, a local pharmacy and drug store. Project funds will be used to replace lighting, heating and air conditioning for energy efficiency improvements to Baker Drug LLC. This project is expected to realize $3,856 in annual energy savings and will save 6,943 kilowatts (kW) of electricity per year. This is enough to power one home.

funding_code: (SECD) (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance the infrastructure needed to deliver potable water to the city of Harlowton, which is a rural community approximately 130 miles east of Helena, Montana. The pipeline will also service about 40 rural towns that lie along the pipelines route and result in providing clean drinking water to Harlowtons residents as well as five other rural communities within central Montana. The proposed infrastructure consists of a disinfection building, pumps, a vault for a surge tank, a small building for housing controls, powerline installation, water tanks, a supervisory control and data acquisition system, a pressure reducing valve, an altitude valve, the connection to Harlowtons water tank, the various rural connections along the water pipeline, and approximately 24 miles of the water transmission main. The project is being funded through both a Water and Waste Disposable loan and a Water and Waste Disposable grant and will directly benefit over 1,000 Montana residents. These funds are leveraged against the Treasure State Regional Water Fund.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance the infrastructure needed to deliver potable water to the city of Harlowton, which is a rural community approximately 130 miles east of Helena, Montana. The pipeline will also service about 40 rural towns that lie along the pipelines route and result in providing clean drinking water to Harlowtons residents as well as five other rural communities within central Montana. The proposed infrastructure consists of a disinfection building, pumps, a vault for a surge tank, a small building for housing controls, powerline installation, water tanks, a supervisory control and data acquisition system, a pressure reducing valve, an altitude valve, the connection to Harlowtons water tank, the various rural connections along the water pipeline, and approximately 24 miles of the water transmission main. The project is being funded through both a Water and Waste Disposable loan and a Water and Waste Disposable grant and will directly benefit over 1,000 Montana residents. These funds are leveraged against the Treasure State Regional Water Fund.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Polebridge Mercantile & Bakery LLC enhance their current renewable energy system from 20 kilowatt hours (kWh) to 60 kilowatt hours (kWh) storage capacity. They will also install a solar hot water system to support their commercial kitchen. These renovations are needed due to their unique "off the grid" location, which is adjacent to the northwestern entrance to Glacier National Park. Polebridge Mercantile & Bakery has been operating since 1914 and draws many tourists to this remote area. This renewable energy upgrade will increase system storage capacity by 50 percent and photovoltaic capacity by 25 percent. The solar hot water system will ease the energy needs of the growing bakery.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
naics_description: ALL OTHER AMUSEMENT AND RECREATION INDUSTRIES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Glacier Guides INC install a 31.94 kW rooftop solar array on their business located at the edge of Glacier National Park. Glacier Guides has been in business since 1983 and has its corporate headquarters in West Glacier, Mont. Glacier Guides provides ecologically sensitive outdoor adventures to the public including hiking, rafting, fishing and biking. With this Renewable Energy Source, 14,757 kw of energy will be replaced by solar with an annual savings of $1129.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide a low-interest loan to Gallatin Development Corporation (doing business as Prospera Business Network) to establish a revolving loan fund, which will be used to alleviate poverty and increase economic activity and employment in rural Gallatin and Park Counties in Montana. The Gallatin Development Corporation will use this funding to make business facility and community development project loans. The Gallatin Development Corporation has identified eight ultimate recipients with projects that are expected to create 46 jobs and save 70 positions.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by DPS Electronics, Inc., a small business in Bozeman, Mont. which designs and manufactures electronics for the railway industry,to make energy-efficiency improvements to their infrastructure. Improvements include the purchase and installation of a 27.52 kW solar array. This project is expected to realize $2,051 in annual savings and likely will generate 25,636 kW of energy per year, which is enough electricity to power 2 homes.

funding_code: LAMP BEGINNING AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS OR RANCHERS RESERVE MANDATORY
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to pay for the costs to support Moon River Ranch LLC to rapidly scale its production of community-supported agriculture to support the food needs of its local community in Clinton, Montana. It will also fund the outreach and marketing needed to engage the local community as well as introduce other producers of eggs, meat, or other agricultural or food items into its distribution system. Moon River Ranch LLC will support its local communities of Clinton, Turah, Drummond, and other communities in Granite County, with fresh, locally grown produce. Much of this area is considered a "food desert," with extremely limited options for shopping. Bringing access to nutritious food to these communities is vital for the health of the communities and their residents. This local support also addresses a critical need that became apparent in 2020 through the COVID pandemic. Developing a reliable local source for a community food that is not reliant on traditional supply chains is necessary for food security. The goal of its project is to develop a naturally grown produce operation that will practice sustainable growing practices, utilizing season-extending tools like hoop-houses and greenhouses to extend the short Montana growing season. Montana agriculture will benefit in several ways. This project will allow the farm to provide nutritious produce to initially 50 families, to over 250 families in the next five years. It will also partner with other local ranches and farms to deliver their products to its members, and have them available for purchase online and at Farmers Markets.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to pay nine employees, purchase cartons and labels, and cover delivery costs for Farmer Boy Eggs, LLC. The farm is a small cage-free, free-range egg operation located in the small farming community of Drummond, Mont., which is about 50 miles southeast of Missoula, a population of approximately 310 residents. Farmer Boy Eggs, LLC was established in 2016 by brothers Alex, Andrew, and Connor Verlanic and sells its eggs to 95 percent of the stores within a 60 mile radius of Drummond. These grant funds are critical for allowing Farmer Boy Eggs, LLC to buy larger orders of blank egg cartons and labels to have the inventory needed to maintain sales despite supply chain back-orders resulting from COVID-19. Farmer Boy Eggs, LLC is a staunch proponent of the local 4-H programs and purchases a handful of animals annually from the students to help grow student agriculture programs within this rural community.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Lake County Community Development Corporation (LCCDC), an economic development organization in Ronan, Montana, which is approximately 65 miles south of Kalispell. LCCDC identified the need to help businesses start up, grow and expand and will use this funding for business development, training and technical assistance in business planning, financial planning, market research, feasibility of products and services, cash flow management, strategic initiatives, and introductions to much-needed technology platforms to showcase and market small businesses. This funding will also support the inclusion of two entrepreneurs or small business owners to participate in Leadership Flathead Reservation (LFR) programming. Engaging new entrepreneurs in this program will open up new opportunities and encourage innovation by developing their leadership skills, increasing interactions within the business community, and building a stronger, more diverse economic base in Western Montana.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will provide funding to Lake County Community Development Corporation (DBA) Mission West Community Development Partners (MWCDP), which is seeking an enterprise grant to conduct a feasibility study for a business accelerator and shared working space to be designated in downtown Polson, Montanas Tax Increment and Finance (TIF) district. Tis funding will be used to fully evaluate the concept of designating a regional co-working space and accelerator in Polson, which is approximately 50 miles south of Kalispell. The accelerator space will provide a shared space for entrepreneurs and prospective rural entrepreneurs to access trainings and receive information and resources specific to rural business. It will also support not only existing businesses but new and emerging businesses as well by providing them with access to resources and a collaborative space. With a low barrier to entry, community members of all backgrounds will have access to business supports that a standalone business might not otherwise access.

funding_code: RURAL COOPERATIVE DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide a grant to Lake County Community Development Corporation. The mission of Lake County Community Development Corporation, doing business as Mission West Community Development Partners, is to enhance the quality of life and sustainable economic well-being of all residents of the rural communities it serves. As a cooperative development center since 1999, cooperative development has been a key tool used by Mission West as a community and economic development strategy in rural Western Montana. Mission West recognizes the potential for cooperatives to help rural communities in Western Montana build robust and sustainable economies, increase community wealth, access critical services, support the work force, and improve quality of life. This project seeks to improve the economic condition and assist in COVID-19 recovery of rural areas through cooperative development, including the operation of a cooperative development center; effective delivery of cooperative development services to rural areas of Western Montana; expanding and strengthening the cooperative development ecosystem; technical assistance to new, emerging cooperatives and new services to further development of existing cooperatives; outreach and education related to cooperatives; program monitoring and evaluation; and strong partnerships that advance cooperative economic development and introduce new models.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND.ENERGY EFFIC IMPROV GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
naics_description: APPAREL ACCESSORIES AND OTHER APPAREL MANUFACTURING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help REcreate Designs LLC, an adult and childrens clothing line, accessories, and home goods made from upcycled materials, make energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. REcreate Designs has been in business since 2005 and is located in St. Ignatius, Montana, about 40 miles north of Missoula. They employ local people and source raw materials from thrift and second-hand outlets and repurpose them into their products. REcreate Designs keeps an estimated 3,000 pounds of waste out of the landfills every year and is proud to be 100 percent made in Montana. Project funds will be used to make energy efficiency improvements with the purchase a new front door and energy-efficient lighting. These upgrades will save the business about $2,100 per year and reduce energy consumption by 7,325 kilowatt hours (kWh) or by nearly 31 percent. This is enough electricity to power one home annually.

funding_code: DISCRETION ASSIST MICROPENTERPRENUERS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide an annual technical assistance grant to Lake County Community Development Corporation to support the initial Rural Microentrepreneur Assistance Program revolving loan fund awarded in fiscal year 2010. Funds will be used to provide technical assistance and training to rural micro-entrepreneurs and microenterprises in Lake County. Lake County Community Development Corporation has previously received two Rural Development Rural Microentrepreneur Assistance Program revolving loans and 10 grants since 2010. These past award amounts are listed as additional federal assistance and appear in this projects total cost.

funding_code: LAMP BEGINNING AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS OR RANCHERS GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund a feasibility study and business plan to assess the viability of a mobile processing unit and cut-and-wrap enterprise for Tribally-produced beef and bison on the Flathead Indian reservation located in Montana. The Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes is a Federally recognized tribe that will contract with a consultant to conduct a market analysis and study to test the feasibility of developing a dual bison and beef meat processing enterprise. The goal of the mobile processing enterprise is to increase local food security and create economic opportunity for the tribe and its members. The importance of food security has become even more apparent during the COVID-19 pandemic when out-of-state meat processing plants were forced to close, and the meat supply was threatened. The proposed business would be a mobile slaughter unit designed to slaughter and partially process grass-fed bison naturally, in their own environment on the National Bison Range, without added stress. The mobile slaughter unit would also provide services to Tribal member cattle producers to slaughter and partially process cattle on-ranch. The revenue derived from the bison production will be utilized to further support conservation of the National Bison Range.

funding_code: LAMP BEGINNING AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS OR RANCHERS GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to pay for the costs of processing dried herbal tea and culinary herbs for Awesome Acres LLC, a small farm located in St. Ignatius, Montana. The farm has been in operation for the last six years and is focused on growing and drying herbs. This project focuses on utilizing the farm-grown raw herbs that, when fresh, can only be sold locally for two months out of the year, and turn them into shelf-stable dried teas and culinary herbs that can be sold throughout the entire year. This year, Awesome Acres, LLC is substantially increasing its herb growing and drying capacity with a new greenhouse and a larger drying shed. The funding from this project will enable it to process their herbs more efficiently, expand into new markets and increase its customer base and the planned income from this project will enable Awesome Acres, LLC to hire a seasonal farm worker, upgrade garden tools, and purchase multiple tractor implements.

funding_code: RCDI RURAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance to Lake County Community Development Corporation (doing business as Mission West Development Partnership, located in Polson, Montana. This technical assistance will help the newly hired Community Development Director with ongoing short and long-term planning, land use regulations, growth policy, code and zoning compliance, and future community development opportunities for Lake County.

funding_code: COMBINATION CF DIRECT LOAN/GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional financing to restructure the parking lot and improve drainage and contouring issues for Lake County Community Development Center, doing business as Mission West Community Development Partners (Mission West). Mission West is located in Ronan, Montana, which is approximately 65 miles south of Kalispell. The parking lot project will replace the surface with a solid surface, which will result in improved safety and parking as well as improved access to storage facilities associated with Mission Wests food business incubator. Mission West provides leadership, community and economic development efforts to address growth issues as they affect residents, communities, and the quality of life in Lake, Mineral and Sanders counties. They also serve The Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes. These funds are leveraged against applicant contributions.

funding_code: COMBINATION CF DIRECT LOAN/GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional financing to restructure the parking lot and improve drainage and contouring issues for Lake County Community Development Center, doing business as Mission West Community Development Partners (Mission West). Mission West is located in Ronan, Montana, which is approximately 65 miles south of Kalispell. The parking lot project will replace the surface with a solid surface, which will result in improved safety and parking as well as improved access to storage facilities associated with Mission Wests food business incubator. Mission West provides leadership, community and economic development efforts to address growth issues as they affect residents, communities, and the quality of life in Lake, Mineral and Sanders counties. They also serve The Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes. These funds are leveraged against applicant contributions.

funding_code: NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES COMMUNITY FACILITY GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to clear and pave a walkway and provide lighting for a safe, lit path across the Salish Kootenai College campus. This path will allow students to choose walking and biking at all hours for quick movement across their large campus. The project will benefit an average of 700 enrolled students annually. Salish Kootenai College is located on the Flathead Reservation in the town of Pablo and in Lake County, Montana. The College is a non-profit organization established with the purpose of providing quality educational programs together with culturally oriented educational opportunities for Native Americans of any tribal background.

program: SEARCH - Special Evaluation Assistance for Rural Communities and Households Grant (WEP)
funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) SEARCH GRANTS WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to to develop an environmental report and preliminary engineering report (PER) for the town of Chester, Montana, which is approximately 95 miles northeast of Great Falls. The PER will identify water treatment and backup power needs, potential solutions, and funding options to determine the appropriate project and methods for updating Chesters water system. The towns water system currently serves 335 residential users and 130 nonresidential users.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop a recreation plan for Troy, Montana, which lies approximately 100 miles west of Kalispell. The city of Troy is partnering with local nonprofits to establish Troy as a hub for outdoor recreation in Northwest Montana. This project will inventory recreation assets, engage the community and develop a recreation plan that will include infrastructure improvements and promotional recommendations. The economic impact of the project will bring regional economic development, tourism development and community revitalization and health to this distressed rural community.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND ENERGY EFF IMPROV GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Lake Camp LLC make energy efficient improvements to a century-old commercial building in downtown Troy, Montana, which lies approximately 100 miles west of Kalispell. The improvements will be made in anticipation of a new distillery and will include new R38 spray foam insulation, double pane vinyl windows, new exterior doors and a two-unit air source heat pump. This project will help with the revitalization of this small, rural town which has suffered as a result of the decline of the timber and mining industries.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to stabilize the foundations below the buildings that comprise The Yaak Schools schoolhouse and teacherage. Funds will also be used to modernize the schools exterior facilities. The Yaak School is a K-8 elementary school serving an isolated, rural mountain community in northwest Montana. This project will comply with state and federal regulations appropriate to school facilities.

borrower_name: TWIN BRIDGES KID COUNTRY DAY CARE, INC.
funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance improvements needed for a day care center located in the rural town of Twin Bridges, Montana, which is located about 90 miles southwest of Bozeman. These improvements will remediate deficiencies and improve operational efficiencies and will include equipment improvements, furnishings improvements, and some outdoor improvements. This is the only day care center located in Twin Bridges and it also provides services for the surrounding rural communities. These funds are leveraged against applicant contributions.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to complete a preliminary engineering report and an environmental report to assess the town of Twin Bridges aging water system and determine improvements needed. The reports will also evaluate and address water and waste disposal storage capacity issues. This project will benefit about 380 people in Madison County,

program: Rural Economic Development Loan and Grant (REDLG)
project_name: FY21 CUSTER CO MULTI USE BLDG
funding_code: RURAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT LOANS (TELEPHONE)
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct a multi-use building in Miles City, Mont., which will be employed for the expansion of tourism events and as a workforce training venue for rural businesses and residents.The facility will also become a part of the Disaster and Emergency Services (DES) Recovery Plan for Custer County, Montana. Over the next three years, the project will enhance rural economic development and strengthen the local economy by supporting at least 15 full time jobs. There has not been any other funding for this project or area.

funding_code: VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER DVLP GRANTS-DISCR
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to process products that can be produced into edible food products such as flour and prepackaged food products from Sikvelands farm commodities. The Sikveland farm is located in the small rural community of Circle, Montana, which had a population of 615 in the 2010 census and has decreased since that time. In Eastern Montana, the farming is dry land farming and rotating crops is necessary for optimal farming practices and conservation of the land. The Sikvelands are increasing the use of pulse crops (chickpeas) and the grant will be used to purchase a one-grain mill that can mill chickpeas and make a gluten free product. It will also be used for launching an extensive marketing plan. This will increase the opportunity for consumers to be able to buy exactly what they want in their small community from local vendors made from local products.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop renewable energy systems and make energy-efficiency improvements which will have a direct benefit to farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in Meagher County, Mont. Withalmost 2,000 total residents,Meagher County lies about 85 miles east of Helena, Mont. and includes the county seat of White Sulphur Springs and the communities of Martinsdale, Checkerboard, Lennep and Ringling.Kathleen Hochstrat is a hay and grain producer who raises and finishes cattle and pigs in Meagher County. These project funds will be used to purchase and install a 19.5 kW solar array on her property and is expected to realize $3,148 in annual energy savings by generating 28,617 kW ofelectricityper year. This is enough to power three homes.

funding_code: (GRANT ONLY) PRE-DEVELOPMENT GRANTS - WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to complete a Preliminary Engineering Report and an Environmental Report for the Martinsdale Water and Sewer Districts water system, which services White Sulphur Springs, a town of approximately 1,000 people that lies about 75 miles east of Helena, Mont. These reports will determine improvements needed for an aging system that is nearly sixty years old. The reports will evaluate and address improvements that may include developing a second water source, replacing seven of the original ten fire hydrants, and replace water mains and services lines which date back to the original installation of the system.

funding_code: DISCRETION ASSIST MICROPENTERPRENUERS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide an annual technical assistance grant to Montana Community Development Corporation to support the initial Rural Microentrepreneur Assistance Program revolving loan fund awarded in Fiscal Year 2011. Funds will be used to provide technical assistance and training to rural micro-entrepreneurs and microenterprises throughout the state of Montana. Montana Community Development Corporation has previously received one Rural Development Rural Microentrepreneur Assistance Program loan and seven grants. These past award amounts are listed as additional Federal assistance and appear in this projects total cost.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund a feasibility analysis for Western Montana Growers Cooperative (WMGC) to expand its infrastructure capacity. WMGC is a farmer-owned cooperative based in Missoula, Montana and supplies a range of locally-grown and raised products including fresh produce, milk, cheese, eggs, lentils, grains, meats, honey, and other value-added products. WMGC distributes these to retailers, restaurants, institutions, and individuals throughout Montana and into Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho. Founded in 2003, WMGC has grown from seven farms to 40 farms and, since moving to its current facility in 2015, WMGC sales have increased by an average of 18 percent per year. Due to this level of growth, WMGC s warehouse and cold storage space are at capacity and this creates a significant barrier to further business development.

funding_code: DISTANCE LEARNING- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support a distance learning and telemedicine initiative, and also help set up the project as a hybrid of non-fixed and fixed end-user sites. The project will also help remove geographical barriers for students and teachers. This project will also aim to offer school-based health care to students in the future. All of the project sites are located on the Crow Nation Reservation, federally recognized as the Crow Tribe of Montana. An estimated 2,500 residents will be served by this project.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 52.7 kilowatt-hour solar array for the Travelodge by Wyndham hotel in Gardiner, Montana. Maric Properties North LLC owns and operates the building, which is located a few miles north of Yellowstone National Park. This project is expected to realize $7,768 in annual cost savings and should generate 70,623 kW per year, which is enough electricity to power six homes.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help finance the purchase of a law enforcement vehicle for the Petroleum County Sheriffs Office. The Rural Development Community Facilities grant funds of $26,700 will be matched with a $21,851 contribution from Petroleum County for a total project cost of $48,551. The new vehicle will replace another vehicle that is nearing the end of its useful life. The new vehicle will provide a reliable means for serving both the Town of Winnett and remote rural areas of the County. The proposed project will be located at the Sheriffs Office in the Town of Winnett, Montana.

funding_code: LAMP BEGINNING AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED FARMERS OR RANCHERS GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Lisa Schmidt, doing business as A Land of Grass, to produce a new stew line for her beef and lamb market. Lisa is a female owned-and-operated rancher in Conrad, Montana, which is in Pondera County,and has been direct-marketing her cuts of natural, grass-fed beef and lamb to local consumers, grocery stores, and restaurants for the past 23 years. The funds will be used to develop a shelf-stable food that will last without refrigeration.

naics_description: RESCUE AND AMBULANCE SERVICE - EQUIPMENT BUILDING
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase a four-wheel drive ambulance, EKG & heart monitor, and automatic chest compression device. The First Responders serves the community EMTs located in Southeastern Montana with a service area of 4,000 sq. miles. The First Responders have received a grant to begin training for a Community Integrated Health program but need a four-wheel drive ambulance and necessary emergency equipment to fully deliver the program to its service area.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MAND ENERGY EFF IMPROV GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Sun Mountain Lumber Inc., a privately held, family-owned forest products company based in Deer Lodge, Montana. The project includes installing a new control system, installing a new 40 horsepower air compressor and dryer to serve the dry kiln and boiler plant, and moving the new 150 horsepower air compressor to a different building. Sun Mountain Lumber was formed in the spring of 2004 and is the largest private employer in the Deer Lodge Valley. This project is expected to save 549,303 kWh of electricity per year, which is enough electricity to power 50 homes and should result in $57,000 in annual energy costs.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funding for Ravalli County Economic Development Authority to conduct the "Ravalli County Public Lands Outdoor Recreation Assessment" which is expected to detail how to better meet the recreation needs of the community. Ravalli County lies approximately 65 miles south of Missoula, Montana, and has a total population of about 43,000 people. The report will identify recreation asset improvement opportunities and will include partnership and funding options to assist small and emerging private business development, as well as business growth, for operators that have primary or secondary revenues derived from the recreation economy. The intent is to provide these businesses with new information that will assist in their post COVID-19 recovery and growth. The project will create 21 jobs.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Finance and Insurance (52)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 12,700 kWh solar array to reduce the electricity consumption by 21 percent annually. Donna Krieger-Pearson, the grantee, owns a mortgage company in Darby, Mont., which is about 65 miles south of Missoula. Krieger-Pearson has been a Real Estate Finance Specialist since 1991 and has partnered with several highly competitive wholesale mortgage lenders. This savings is enough electricity to power one home on a yearly basis and is expected to save the business $762 in annual energy costs.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Double K Ranch, LLC in the purchase and installation of a 29,100 kWh solar system on its cattle ranch. This is a family-owned, locally operated ranch that raises hormone and antibiotic-free cattle. In operation since 1987, the animals are born, raised, and processed on the property, which is located in Darby, Mont., about 60 miles south of Missoula. This project is expected to replace 29,100 kWh of electricity per year with solar power, which is 49 percent of the farms usage and is enough electricity to power two homes. The project is also expected to save the farm $3,463 in annual energy costs.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Fireroot Distillery LLC develop renewable energy systems and make energy-efficiency improvements for distillery operation in Florence, Montana. FireRoot Spirits, which is a family-run company nestled between the Sapphire and Bitterroot Mountain ranges, planted their orchard in spring of 2016. The business now has a mix of nineteen varieties of apples, with over 400 cider apple trees. This project involves installing a 14,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) solar system to reduce electric usage in FireRoot Spirits manufacturing plant. Total project cost is $30,708, and the owners will complete the construction and this project includes $3,927 in grant funds.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Wildwood Brewing Incorporated, a craft brewery in Stevensville, Montana, purchase and install a 50,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) solar array system which will power the brewery. This project is expected to realize $4,050 in annual cost savings and will replace/save 50,000 kilowatt hours (kWh) of electricity per year. This project is expected to lower the brewerys energy use by 40 percent annually. This is enough electricity to power four homes.

project_name: FY 21 VAPG MKTG CAGE FREE EGGS
funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund working capital for Buck N Daves Eggs LLC, a company growing local, humanely raised egg-laying chickens in the rural town of Corvallis, Montana. Buck N Daves Eggs LLC is an agricultural business that provides clean, fresh eggs to consumers within a 150 mile radius from the ranch and started in 2019, with two friends from the rodeo circuit, becoming partners to promote a holistic and grassroots approach to bring genetically modified organism-free and free-range chicken eggs to the local area and economy. This project will allow Buck N Daves to create one new job and increase egg production in their business by 10,000 more eggs per week. The target of this project grant is to expand the market to have sales of the 13,500 eggs to be sold in 24 grocery stores, six convenience stores and five restaurants in their local community.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund working capital for FireRoot Distillery LLC to leverage new technologies to compete in the spirits industry, all while protecting the local environment and sustaining energy-efficient practices. The distillery, located in Florence, Montana, produces four value-added products distilling apples into aged spirits. The goal of this project is to introduce a new Brandy and Whiskey by implementing a rapid-aging technique that uses ultrasonic processing. The method has been successfully accomplished with bench trials, but the grant will allow large-scale production with an extremely short turn-around. What normally takes about 3-10 years of aging in barrels can be accomplished in a matter of days with ultrasonic processing, which will save the company space, time, and energy. The company hopes to eventually expand distribution to Washington, Oregon, and California. FireRoot Distillery, LLCs products have been sold throughout Montana for three years and the company has won national awards from "Sip Magazine," including a double gold medal for its AppleJack and a Bronze medal for its Apple Jill.

funding_code: VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER DVLP GRANTS-DISCR
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to increase manufacturing of gourmet jams and syrup products made by Melissa A. Allred, an independent producer. Aspen Grove Farm, LLC is a six-acre berry farm located in Corvallis, Montana. Ms. Allred grows several different varieties of berries with the main crop being honeyberries or haskaps. The mission of the farm is to bring new fruit varieties into the local markets.

funding_code: LAMP VALUE ADDED PRODUCER GRANT MANDATORY
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
naics_description: BROILERS AND OTHER MEAT TYPE CHICKEN PRODUCTION
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to fund working capital for Living River Farms LLC. This company grows local, pasture-raised chickens in Stevensville, Montana. In a collaboration, Living River Farms LLC opened a state-licensed facility to process chickens for retail and wholesale and they use the facility to process chickens. The farm employs eight part-time employees, half of which have special needs. They work to empower their employees with job skills and training so that they may be more qualified for other job opportunities when they arise. Living River Farms LLC has a great opportunity to expand its business by increasing the quantity of cut-up chicken to its product line. While it has success selling whole chickens, it has also seen that after two years of selling chicken parts, there is opportunity for growth in this area. By cutting up a larger quantity of whole chickens, the farm will be able to grow its market share, gain new accounts, and increase its profitability.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install sidewalks throughout the campus, install a concrete drive-thru near the JES Library and install new windows in the War Eagle Vision Building for the Fort Peck Community College. Fort Peck Community College is located on the Fort Peck Indian Reservation, which is located within rural Roosevelt County. The College is a non-profit organization established with the purpose of providing quality educational programs together with culturally oriented educational opportunities for residents of the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. The project will benefit and average of 340 enrolled students and Rural Development funds along with local funds will be used to assist the College in improving the conditions of the campus.

naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for the construction of a greenhouse addition to the science classroom at the Chief Dull Knife Community College. This will enable students to germinate, plant, and harvest species of plants important to the Northern Cheyenne Tribe. Chief Dull Knife Community College is located on the Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation, which is located within rural Rosebud County and parts of Big Horn County. The College is a non-profit organization established with the purpose of providing quality educational programs together with culturally oriented educational opportunities for residents of the Northern Cheyenne Reservation. The College was incorporated in the 1970s. The project will benefit an average of 400 student enrollees. Rural Development funds along with local funds will be used to assist the college in the construction of the greenhouse addition.

project_name: FY21 RBDG THOMPSON FALLS REC E
funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funding for theThompson Falls Recreation Economy Infrastructure Plan, which will include recreation tourism outreach and promotion for this town which is approximately100 miles northwest of Missoula, Mont. It is the vision that Thompson Falls can be a more desirable destination along Hwy 200 as visitors travel between national parks and other amenities in western Montana. This project emerged as a priority from the US EPAs Recreation Economy for Rural Communities (RERC) Program and correlating Action Plan. The 2020 RERC process in Thompson Falls was a coordinated effort to develop community-based priorities and an action plan for this rural community to make meaningful progress in implementing its economic vision. The project will support or create nearly 27 jobs.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist WHP Properties LLC, a holding company for Plains Physical Therapy in Plains, Montana, purchase and install a 14,060 kilowatt hours (kWh) solar array for the physical therapy business, which is owned by Emily Herndon. This solar array system is expected to realize $2,520 per year in savings and lower WHP Properties LLCs energy use by 87 percent annually. This is enough electricity to power one home.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase firefighter safety turnout gear for 10 volunteer firefighters at the Plains Paradise Rural Fire Department, which is located approximately 75 miles northwest of Missoula, Mont. Gear will include helmets, boots, hoods and gloves as well as flex gear used for quick EMS responses. Having this gear will allow the Plains Paradise Rural Fire Department to outfit the volunteer firefighters in updated gear, resulting in increased safety and survivability. The Plains community is barely above the HHS poverty guideline and this fire department runs on minimal cash while serving a large physical area.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the city of Thompson Falls, which is approximately 100 miles northeast of Missoula, Montana, to upgrade and extend their wastewater collection and treatment systems. This Phase Three funding will support the continuation of the Phase One and Phase Two projects that are currently in construction and partially funded by USDA Rural Development. Phase Three will add 189 parcels and connect to the upgraded Lagoon Wastewater Treatment System. Adding these users will contribute revenue to the operations and maintenance of the entire system and connect a large portion of the town that was previously not connected.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to help create a marketing project including branding, videography and digital media for Montana Craft Malt, which is located in Butte, MT. Montana Craft Malt is a one-of-a-kind facility, both in its production scale and its design and addresses the unique and previously underserved needs of the booming regional craft brewing and distilling industries. The project will not only directly affect Montana Craft Malt, but will benefit the other businesses assisted by Montana Craft Malt. Fifteen jobs will be supported/saved and fifteen jobs will be created.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used for website development to increase awareness and product sales for Ruby Valley Brew, which is located in Sheridan, Mont., which is approximately 55 miles south of Butte. Ruby Valley Brew began operation in 2017. Seven jobs will be supported/saved and three jobs will be created with this project.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to help create a new website and marketing materials for Butte Food Co-op. Butte Food Co-op was established in 2021 and provides high quality grocery offerings to residents of Butte, Mont. With the website development, Butte Food Co-op will be able to expand their outreach to target residents and tourists of Butte, as well as the surrounding counties of Jefferson, Madison, Beaverhead, and Deer Lodge. Eleven jobs will be supported/saved and eleven jobs will be created.

funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Other or Not Defined
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to update "Our Lady of the Rockies" website and create brochures for this Montana tourist attraction. "Our Lady of the Rockies," a 90-foot statue built in the likeliness of Mary, the mother of Jesus, is one of Buttes top tourist attractions and was erected in December, 1985, on top of Buttes Continental Divide. With an updated website, they will be able to target local residents, tourists, and the sounding areas of Gallatin, Jefferson, Madison, Beaverhead, Powell, Granite, Deer Lodge, Missoula, and Lewis and Clark counties. Three jobs will be supported/saved and one job will be created.

funding_code: APPROPRIATE TECH TRANSFER TO RURAL AREAS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
naics_description: REGULATION AND ADMINISTRATION OF TRANSPORTATION PROGRAMS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist the Appropriate Technology Transfer for Rural Areas (ATTRA*) program. The program is founded and managed by the National Center for Appropriate Technology (NCAT), a private, nonprofit organization with headquarters in Butte, MT. *ATTRA project is known as the National Sustainable Agriculture Information Service. The purpose of the ATTRA program is to provide information to farmers and other rural users on a variety of sustainable agricultural practices The sustainable practices include both cropping and livestock operations, and also encourages agricultural producers to adopt sustainable agricultural practices that allow them to maintain or improve profits, produce high quality food and reduce adverse impacts to the environment.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 58.5 kW solar array. Pioneer Meats, Inc, is a well-known meat processor located in Big Timber, Montana, which is about 60 miles east of Bozeman. It is expected to realize $9,276 in annual cost savings and should generate 88,346 kW per year, which is enough electricity to power eight homes.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to pay for processing and marketing cattle on the Basin Inc. Ranch. This ranch is a family-owned operation, headed by Brian Hagerman, a fourth-generation Montanan. Cattle raised on the Hagerman ranch are all-natural, grass-fed livestock. Hagerman also utilizes the IMI Global platform for his herd, in which calves have chips inserted that facilitate tracking of the health and management of the animal. It is a program used worldwide to show the all-natural method of animal management. Basin Inc. would like to expand their direct market to customers, increase the identification and reputation of Basin Inc. beef, and increase feed and soil programs to align with regenerative practices.

funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to develop renewable energy systems and make energy-efficiency improvements which will have a direct benefit to farmers, ranchers, and rural small businesses in Teton County, Mont. Located on the Rocky Mountain Front about 60 miles west of Great Falls, Mont., Teton County is sparsely populated and includes the communities of Bynum, Choteau, Dutton, Fairfield, Pendroy and Power. Eric Harris, the sole operator of a family-owned farm and ranch, will use the project funds for the purchase and installation of a 310 Watt solar array system. The project is expected to realize $1,589 in annual energy savings and will replace/save 13,243 kWh of electricity per year. This is enough to power one home.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the town of Fairfield, which lies approximately 90 miles north of Helena, MT, replace leaking copper service lines and deteriorating asbestos cement distribution system piping which dates back to the 1940s. Funding will also provide additional looping in specific system locations and will help the town replace fire hydrants and gate valves along with various other appurtenances and fittings.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to upgrade and replace the 6,000 linear feet of aging cast-iron waterline with 6,000 linear feet of 8-inch polyvinyl chloride (PVC) pipe. This will improve the city of Choteaus water and waste disposal systems by eliminating backflow events. Choteau is the county seat of Teton County, and because it is located in between Glacier and Yellowstone National Parks, it serves as the Gateway to the Rocky Mountain Front. This funding will provide the infrastructure needed to ensure safe and potable water for Choteaus approximately 1,700 full-time residents, as well as the influx of tourists who visit the area.

funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Jeff Sather, a fourth generation rancher, who owns and operates his family ranch in Opheim, Montana, which is approximately 50 miles north of Glasgow. Sathers family ranch was founded in 1922 and its primary enterprises are small grains, hay, cow-calf and heifer development. Sather will use the project funds for the purchase and installation of three 10 kilowatt hours (kWh) micoinverters and the project is expected to realize 4,500 kilowatt hours (kWh) of energy per month.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance much needed equipment for the Wheatland County Sheriffs Department located in the rural town of Harlowton, Montana, which is approximately 93 miles northwest of Billings. This funding will be used to purchase eleven body cameras, five truck cameras and body armor and law enforcement equipment for four police officers. The sheriffs department provides public safety for Wheatland County and Golden Valley County, which is comprised of about 3,000 residents. These grant funds are leveraged against applicant contributions.

funding_code: CF TAT GRANT (SECTION 6006)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for a technical assistance grant to finance a feasibility study for Wheatland Memorial Hospital located in Harlowton, Montana. This formal financial feasibility study is needed in order to apply for an approximated $14,000,000.00 Community Facilities Guaranteed Loan for the construction of a new hospital facility. This facility proposes to consist of a hospital, clinic, and swing/long term care beds. This new facility will service not only Wheatland County, but also Golden Valley County and Meagher County.

funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
naics_description: SUPERMARKETS AND OTHER GROCERY (EXCEPT CONVENIENCE) STORES
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand key components of the Yellowstone Valley Food Hub marketing, aggregation, and distribution system. The food hub is an officially incorporated, producer-owned, agricultural marketing cooperative formed in February 2019 as a vital instrument to address the economic barriers faced by many small-scale producers, and the lack of local food retail, marketing and distribution infrastructure, in central and eastern Montana. Yellowstone Valley Food Hubis passionate about expanding their market to support the communities of Billings, Montana. and meet the growing demand for food.

borrower_name: Worden/Ballantine Yellowstone County Water & Sewer District
funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to secure a new drinking water source by constructing new groundwater wells, a well house, and a water main crossing with 8" mains. The median household income of its service area is $22,295, which positions the District within Rural Developments poverty category.Rural Development funds along with local funds, will be used to assist the District in securing a new water source as its users are currently only able to drink bottled water.The Districts current water source is failing, and new infrastructure is needed to alleviate serious health and sanitary violations.

borrower_name: Lockwood Area Yellowstone County Water and Sewer District
funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used for the Phase 3 sewer sub-district project area with Lockwood Water and Sewer District, which is located in Lockwood, MT, a rural community of approximately 7,000 people that lies about 7 miles northeast of Billings. Funds will be used for the installation of nearly 70,640 lineal feet of gravity sewer main with manholes and the facilities will be designed and constructed in accordance with sound engineering practices.

project_announced_description: Big Horn Hospital Association is a non-profit organization which operates an 18-bed critical access hospital, a 36-bed nursing home and 10 assisted living apartments in Hardin. They also provide emergency services for the city of Hardin, which has a population of 12,865 and a median household income (MHI) of $36,550. This Rural Development funding will help Big Horn Hospital Association acquire a new electronic health record (EHR) system and associated software which will interface with Billings Clinic facilities, which is where patients are often sent for further care. The seamless transition of records and information as patients utilize both healthcare providers will result in integrated record keeping and promote patient portal use for rural populations.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct the Anaakyaaniiin Wellness Center in Hays, Montana. Hays is on the Fort Belknap Indian Reservation, which is in Blaine County. Bear Paw Development Corporation will work with Opportunity Link, Fort Belknap Indian Community Council, and Fort Belknap Community Economic Development Corporation to produce an integrated health care platform and program to increase access to health care services, recruit and retain providers and professionals, integrate traditional, cultural beliefs and resources, and offer overall healing and wellness to members of the community. Bear Paw Development Corporation is a non-profit economic development corporation located in Havre, Montana.

funding_code: MEAT & POULTRY IRP GRANTS - ARPA
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
naics_description: ADMINISTRATION OF URBAN PLANNING AND COMMUNITY AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT
project_announced_description: The organizations mission is to help fund existing and startup meat and poultry processing operations in the Great Falls Montana region, increase and diversify production, process a higher percentage of livestock raised in the region, and grow the industry in such a way as to lower operating costs for processors. GFDA also creates high-wage career opportunities that improve quality of life and the environment.

funding_code: RURAL COOPERATIVE DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support the operations of the Montana Cooperative Development Center. As the official statewide cooperative development center, Montana Cooperative Development Centers mission is to provide technical assistance to rural cooperatives across the state through their office and a contracted network of economic developers that serve as entry points and identifiers for cooperative projects. Their goals are to effectively serve Montanas 56 counties and eight Tribal Sovereign Nations to improve the economic conditions through cooperative development and to support and nurture the cooperatives and businesses.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY GRANTS TO ASSIST MINORITY PRODUCERS
naics_industry_sector: Information (51)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Montana Cooperative Development Center, a non-profit organization, in funding technical assistance to support the development of programming and feasibility work for indigenous communities to build local solutions using cooperative business models. The funding will also support women equity programs for Montana women. Montana Cooperative Development Center will provide most of the work internally with the assistance of three contracted specialists. Partnerships include working with Native Ways on a feasibility study and business plan development, the Economic Development Administration for workforce development and a private financial planning company for strengthening start-up cooperatives.

funding_code: CF GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase fire fighting and safety equipment. This project will allow for the purchase of extractors, dryers, self-contained breathing apparatus and hose wash equipment, an electronic monitor for a fire truck, an air compressor, and other equipment. Black Eagle Volunteer Fire Departments service area includes 949 residents that are eligible for assistance according to the most recent census.
