borrower_name: BIGHORN VALLEY HEALTH CENTER DBA ONE HEALTH
funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to renovate a historic building in downtown Miles City, Montana to offer health care resources. The building will include a pharmacy, dental clinic, public meeting space, clinical training program, Custer County Public Health Department integration, and space for support and administrative personnel. The clinical floor will include several exam rooms, the telemedicine delivery hub, and education space for residents from the Montana Family Medicine Residency program, lab spaces, and an area for vaccine administration and COVID-19 testing. The project also includes a network of satellite sites that will be serviced via telehealth from the Miles City hub. Miles City, Montana is located in Custer County.

borrower_name: BIGHORN VALLEY HEALTH CENTER DBA ONE HEALTH
funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to renovate a historic building in downtown Miles City, Montana to offer health care resources. The building will include a pharmacy, dental clinic, public meeting space, clinical training program, Custer County Public Health Department integration, and space for support and administrative personnel. The clinical floor will include several exam rooms, the telemedicine delivery hub, and education space for residents from the Montana Family Medicine Residency program, lab spaces, and an area for vaccine administration and COVID-19 testing. The project also includes a network of satellite sites that will be serviced via telehealth from the Miles City hub. Miles City, Montana is located in Custer County. One Health is the lead applicant for the Track 2 funding, which required a consortium of three or more members to apply. The other consortium members are Custer County Public Health Department, Chief Dull Knife College, and Montana Family Medicine Residency Program. One Health is based out of Hardin, MT and is a non-profit healthcare provider. Including the areas serviced by the satellite sites, this project will benefit a service area population of 45,282.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development Investment will be used to help purchase canning equipment to lease to Smelter City Brewing. Smelter City Brewing is an existing brewery that has been in operation in Anaconda Deer Lodge County since 2017. With the adoption of new canning equipment, Smelter City Brewing will be able to increase their production and output and thirteen jobs will be supported or saved. Additionally, two jobs will be created as a result of this project funding.

project_name: GRHCG TRACT ONE CHA IT SWITCH
funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase an IT switch that will enhance the Community Hospital of Anacondas telehealth services. The Community Hospital of Anaconda is a Critical Access Hospital which provides services to a medically underserved area in Deer Lodge County, and is located approximately 100 miles southeast of Missoula. The IT switch is needed to allow better clarity for telemedicine and will result in fewer video and audio interruptions during patient conferencing. The switch will also alleviate IT-related storage issues. Rural Development funds, along with local funds, will be used to assist Anaconda, Deer Lodge, and surrounding areas with the best capability for telemedicine service and improved technology during the immediate and foreseeable future.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand the customer base and enhance profitability of Lane Unlimited Inc. dba Lane Legacy Beef. This is a woman-owned operation located near Ismay, Montana, a rural community of less than 20 people. Lane Legacy is a family operated farm/ranch producing locally raised Black Angus cattle for high-quality, premium grass-fed beef. The operation targets sales to the local community, region, and neighboring states. The funding will assist with processing and marketing costs as it relates to the entry into the market. The operation is projected to grow to 100+ customers and increase $54,000 in sales during the grant period.

funding_code: (SECD) (GRANT ONLY) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to finance the infrastructure needed to deliver clean water to the city of Harlowton and approximately 40 users along the water pipeline route. This infrastructure will consist of a disinfection building, pumps, vault for a surge tank and small building for housing controls, installation of powerlines, water tanks, supervisory control and data acquisition system, pressure reducing valve, altitude valve, connection to Harlowtons tank, the various rural connections along the water pipeline, and approximately 24 miles of water transmission main. The infrastructure is being built to develop the capacity to provide potable drinking water to the almost 1,000 residents in Harlowton and the users along the pipeline route. It is also the cornerstone to providing water to other residents in five other Central Montana communities.

borrower_name: OHS AUTO BODY, INC. & CVR HOLDINGS, LLC
funding_code: GUARANTEED B&I 3% FEE LOAN
naics_industry_sector: Other Services (except Public Administration) (81)
naics_description: AUTOMOTIVE BODY, PAINT, AND INTERIOR REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to refinance a current Small Business Administration (SBA) loan which has a very high interest rate. Ohs Auto Body Inc. is a small business with four shop locations serving the rural communities of Polson, Whitefish, Columbia Falls and Kalispell, Montana, as well as the surrounding Flathead Valley. Refinancing will save the company approximately $8,000 per month. Ohs Auto Body maintains a full-time staff of 43 employees and experiences very low turnover rate.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants

naics_industry_sector: Manufacturing (31-33)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist House of Yum LLC develop a renewable energy systems and make energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. House of Yum LLC is a bakery and caf that has been in business for over six years in Columbia Falls, Montana. Project funds will be used to install an 8.4 kilowatt-hours (kWh) solar array, which is expected to provide 8,865 kWh, or 14 percent of the annual electrical consumption at their location.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Moss Mountain Inn, a quaint bed and breakfast on the remote North Fork Road near Columbia Falls, Montana, install a 29.6 kilowatt-hour (kWh) solar array. This project is expected to realize $10,909 per year in savings and should generate 26,308 kWh annually, or 62.6 percent of their annual electrical consumption, which is enough electricity to power two homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Polebridge Penny LLC make energy-efficient improvements to their operations. Polebridge Penny LLC is a sought-after tiny house rental in the remote, off-grid community of Polebridge, Montana. Project funds will be used to install a 4.8 kilowatt-hours (kWh) solar array on their business. This project is expected to provide 5,732 kWh of clean, renewable energy and decrease Polebridge Pennys reliance on propane, wood and natural gas in their remote North Fork Road location.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Nelson Real Estate Holdings LLC install a 29.52 kilowatt-hour (kWh) solar array on its business, Nelsons Ace Hardware, which is in the rural community of Whitefish, Montana. The hardware store has been continuously owned and operated by the Nelson family for over 70 years and is a staple to the Whitefish community. This project is expected to provide 33,204 kWh, or 26 percent, of the annual electrical consumption needed for their new location, which, in 2019, doubled the size of their building.

funding_code: VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER DVLP GRANTS-DISCR
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand customer base and increase profitability of Big Sky Orchard of Big Fork, Montana. The Orchard has been producing and selling pelletized hops to craft breweries in Montana since 2018. This operation is valuable to breweries across the state by keeping it local.

naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase an existing hotel, Comfort Suites, located in Bozeman, Montana. The Comfort Suites Hotel first opened in 2013 and has 80 rooms. It is conveniently located along Interstate 90 exit and less than ten miles from the Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport. This investment will provide the business with increased cash flow and allow the owner to create two new jobs and retain their current 20 employees.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Retail Trade (44-45)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Brandon Hay Furniture LLC, a woodworking shop in Belgrade, Montana, make energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 7.9 kilowatt (kW) solar photovoltaic system, and a heating and cooling system, which is expected to realize $1,313 per year in savings. This project should save 10,943 kW annually, which is enough electricity to power one home.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: REAP-MANDATORY RENEW ENERGY SYST GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help Cows for Cabins LLC, a short-term rental company in Belgrade, Montana, purchase and install a 24.00 kilowatt (kW) solar photovoltaic (PV) system. This project is expected to realize $3,644 per year in savings and should save 33,484 kilowatt hours (kWh) annually, which is enough electricity to power three homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services (54)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist a rural small businesses in developing renewable energy systems and in making energy-efficiency improvements to its operations. Consulting Design Solutions Inc. founded in 2007, is a Montana-based consulting firm that specializes in both electrical and mechanical building design. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 14.4 kilowatt (kW) solar array on the business located in Manhattan, Montana. This project is expected to realize $1,545 per year in savings and should generate 17,206 kW of energy annually, which is enough electricity to power almost two homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
naics_description: LESSORS OF RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS AND DWELLINGS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist a rural small business in developing renewable energy systems and in making energy-efficiency improvements to its operations. Yellowstone Vacation Rentals LLC has been in business since 2013 and specializes in providing accommodations for people visiting the Yellowstone area. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 8.28 2 kilowatt (kW) solar array on the Fox Den Lodge property in West Yellowstone, Montana. This project is expected to realize $1,228 per year in savings and should generate 11,245 kW of energy per year, which is enough electricity to power one home.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand the customer base and increase profitability of Belcrest Farms, located just 15 miles from the heart of downtown Bozeman, Montana. Belcrest Farms is a small, family-owned operation. The business prides themselves on all-natural, dry-aged, ranch raised beef. Grant funds will be used for the value-added production of finished beef to packaged meat in the areas of product distribution, marketing, advertising, operations, and payroll.

funding_code: RBCS DEVELOPMENT GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support training and technical assistance in business planning, financial planning, market research, feasibility of products and services, cash flow management, strategic initiatives, and introductions to much-needed technology platforms to showcase and market small businesses. This funding will also support the inclusion of two entrepreneurs or small business owners to participate in LCCDCs Leadership Flathead Reservation (LFR) programming. Engaging new entrepreneurs in this program will open up new opportunities and encourage innovation by developing their leadership skills, increasing interactions within the business community, and building a stronger, more diverse economic base.

funding_code: RURAL COOPERATIVE DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Lake County Community Development Center in their mission to provide technical assistance and access to capital resources to new and expanding cooperative and mutually-owned businesses throughout the northwest rural region and the Flathead Indian Reservation of Montana. For more than 20 years, Lake County Community Development Center has been a catalyst and connector in the development of cooperatives and regional food systems in Montana. This project will promote the development, expansion, and operational improvement of rural cooperatives and improve the economic conditions in rural areas.

naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to support Lake County Community Development Corporation to provide technical assistance and training to rural microentrepreneurs and microenterprises in Lake County, Montana.

naics_industry_sector: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing (53)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Goodkind Gulch LLC make energy-efficient improvements to their operations. Goodkind Gulch LLC is a rental office space building in historic downtown Helena, Montana. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 20.91 kilowatt (kW) solar photovoltaic system, which is expected to realize $2,029 per year in savings. This solar project should save 25,364 kW annually, which is enough electricity to power two homes.

funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist a rural small business in developing renewable energy systems and in making energy-efficiency improvements to its operations. Canebrake Vineyards owns the building which houses the Montana Health Center in Helena, Montana. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 23.7 kilowatt (kW) roof-mounted solar array. funding_code: LOCAL AGRICULTURE MARKET RESOURCE PROGRAM (LAMP) VALUE-ADDED PRODUCER GRANTS - COVID
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to expand the customer base and enhance profitability of North of Nowhere Farm LLC, a majority-woman owned business near Opheim, Montana. This is a rural farming community in Northeastern Montana with a population of 75 people. The owners possess a shared belief that good health is dependent on good nutrition and healthy soil to produce a high-quality food commodity. The family operated farm utilizes regenerative agriculture practices when raising their grass-fed beef to produce high protein, nutritional beef sticks. The grant will provide funding assistance toward the processing costs with the intent to feature products in state-wide convenience stores. North of Nowhere is expected to increase sales by $50,000 and build customer base by 300 during the grant period.

program: Rural Energy for America Program Renewable Energy Systems and Energy Efficiency Improvement Loans and Grants
funding_code: MAND. RENEW ENERFY SYSTEMS GRANTS UNDER $20,000
naics_industry_sector: Arts, Entertainment, and Recreation (71)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Stone Temple Fitness & Spa LLC develop a renewable energy system and in making energy-efficiency improvements to their operations. Stone Temple Fitness and Spa LLC is a full service, boutique gym and day spa in White Sulphur Springs, Montana. Project funds will be used to purchase and install a 19.58 kilowatt (kW) solar photovoltaic system (PV), which is expected to realize $2,657 per year in savings. This solar project should save 22,750 kilowatt hours (kWh) annually, which is enough electricity to power two homes.

The family-owned operation is a mixed vegetable market garden located in Martinsdale, a small rural town in central Montana. Because of the rural location, it makes this business even more valuable to the area and surrounding communities allowing access to fresh produce. Grant funds will be used to assist marketing, labor, distribution and packaging efforts.

funding_code: ELEC SECTION 4 TREASURY RATE
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to connect 65 consumers and build and improve 34 miles of line. This loan includes $670,350 in smart grid technologies. Goldenwest Electric is headquartered in the city of Wibaux, Montana serving 1,610 consumers over 1,171 miles of line through a total of six counties: three counties in North Dakota and three counties in Montana.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deploy a fiber-to-the-premises network that will connect 89 people, five businesses and 47 farms to high-speed internet in Ravalli County. Blackfoot will make high-speed internet affordable by offering low-cost options at speeds sufficient for multiple users to simultaneously telework and engage in remote learning. Blackfoot will participate in the Federal Communications Commissions Lifeline and Affordable Connectivity Programs, providing discounts on broadband services.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND 100% GRANT- RBS REDG SUB ACCOUNT SEC. 762- GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deploy a fiber-to-the-premises network. This network will connect 1,058 people, 25 businesses and 282 farms to high-speed internet in Roosevelt and Valley counties. Nemont will make high-speed internet affordable by offering a suite of broadband services designed to be simple. It will target residents and businesses on the Fort Peck Indian Reservation. All services offered will be symmetrical and capable of supporting multiple simultaneous users for many applications, including teleworking and remote learning. This project will serve socially vulnerable communities in Roosevelt County and on the Fort Peck Indian Reservation.

funding_code: PILOT BROADBAND GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to deploy a fiber-to-the-premises network. This network will connect 693 people, 16 businesses, one educational facility, and 23 farms to high-speed internet in Big Horn and Yellowstone counties in Montana. Project Telephone Company will make high-speed internet affordable by implementing the FCCs Affordable Connectivity Program. This project will serve portions of the Crow Reservation, Fort Smith and Pompeys Pillar areas.

Black Dog Farm has been in operation for five years and will use Value-Added Producer Grant funds to increase their family-owned pasture-based pork, poultry, and egg farm. Specifically, funds will be used for processing, packaging and marketing of the products as the business continues to excel in the growing Bozeman community and beyond.

naics_industry_sector: Wholesale Trade (42)
naics_description: FRESH FRUIT AND VEGETABLE MERCHANT WHOLESALERS
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Montana Greenhouse Project 365 LLC, an independent farm in Saco, Montana, with working capital financing needed to expand its customer base and increase its revenue stream. Owner Christian Simpson grows greenhouse vegetables and fruits that he sells to local schools, restaurants and individuals and provides health classes twice a month to educate the surrounding public about his healthy produce. His greenhouse is vital to the communities of Saco, Hisdale and Whitewater as it provides year-round produce to an otherwise food desert area. His expanded market will include nursing homes and the nearby Ft. Belknap reservation. This project is estimated to create two jobs.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to assist Math Farms Beef in Whitewater, Montana expand its customer market and revenue share. Math Farms beef sells 100 percent pure Angus beef that has been pasture-raised and grain finished. The grant will be used for processing, packaging, and marketing the beef as well as overhead expenses for the operation. The project is expected to create one job and save two.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve the town of Valiers wastewater system by installing influent screening, removing accumulated sludge, replacing 1,900 linear feet of collection main, and installing three required manholes. The rural town of Valier is approximately 160 miles north of Helena and has a population of about 530 residents. Rural Development funds, along with state and local funds, will support wastewater improvements which should lessen the operators exposures to hazardous conditions, increase the total lagoon volume, and mitigate the back up of raw sewage into homes, the towns school and other community infrastructure.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This USDA Rural Development Emergency Rural Health Care (ERHC) Grant Track 1 investment will be used to purchase two ambulances and related equipment for Powder River County. Broadus, Montana is the County Seat for Powder River County, which is an isolated, rural, and medically underserved area in the southeastern corner of the state. Powder River County recently took over the provision of emergency ambulance services for the area, as no provider was interested or available to serve the Countys almost 2,000 residents. The project approval is to purchase two new ambulances and related equipment and Rural Development funds, along with local funds, will be used to improve emergency services for this rural area.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by Prairie County Hospital (doing business as Prairie Community Hospital), in Terry, Montana, to increase the size and improve the function of the hospitals emergency department. Prairie County Hospital is a county-owned critical access hospital that provides clinical and emergency services. The hospital is a certified Trauma Receiving Facility which fills a critical need in the community and surrounding areas. Funding will also be used to expand the laboratory capabilities, improve patient services, and improve select support spaces.

funding_code: CF ARP EMERGENCY RURAL HEALTH CARE GRANTS - TRACK 1 & 2
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional financing to increase the size and improve the function of the current emergency department for Prairie County Hospital. Prairie County Hospital is a county-owned Critical Access Hospital that provides clinical and emergency services. In addition, it is also a certified trauma receiving facility and supports emergency needs for a large area. The hospitals emergency department does not have appropriate treatment space, privacy, or control. This investment will allow the hospital to expand for two large trauma treatment bays, expand laboratory capabilities, improve patient services, and support spaces.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase equipment for the maintenance of vehicles for the Chief Dull Knife Community College. The college is located on the Northern Cheyenne Indian Reservation, which is also located within rural Rosebud and parts of Big Horn Counties. The college is a non-profit organization established for the purpose of providing quality educational programs together with culturally oriented educational opportunities for residents of the Northern Cheyenne Reservation. The college will purchase equipment to include vehicle servicing equipment for the maintenance area and the field research station will receive two major pieces of new equipment to help facilitate the ongoing research of the college.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to continue to upgrade the wastewater system and support the continuation of developments that are currently in construction and partially funded by Rural Development. Thompson Falls is about 100 miles northwest of Missoula and has a population of just over 1,300 people. These funds will be used to connect 137 benefitted parcels, which were previously un-sewered, to the citys upgraded lagoon wastewater treatment system. With this implementation, the city will increase revenues which will be used for the wastewater infrastructures operation and maintenance costs. These Rural Development funds will support wastewater improvements which should lessen hazardous conditions resulting from failing septic systems.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to continue to upgrade the city of Thompson Falls wastewater system and support the continuation of developments that are currently in construction and partially funded by Rural Development. Thompson Falls is about 100 miles northwest of Missoula and has a population of just over 1,300 people. These funds will be used to connect 137 benefitted parcels, which were previously un-sewered, to the citys upgraded lagoon wastewater treatment system. With this implementation, the city will increase revenues which will be used for the wastewater infrastructures operation and maintenance costs. These Rural Development funds will support wastewater improvements which should lessen the operators exposures to hazardous conditions and mitigate the back up of raw sewage into homes and other infrastructure as a result of failing septic systems.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to continue to upgrade the city of Thompson Falls wastewater system and support the continuation of developments that are currently in construction and partially funded by Rural Development. Thompson Falls is about 100 miles northwest of Missoula and has a population of just over 1,300 people. These funds will be used to connect 137 benefitted parcels, which were previously un-sewered, to the citys upgraded lagoon wastewater treatment system. With this implementation, the city will increase revenues which will be used for the wastewater infrastructures operation and maintenance costs. These Rural Development funds will support wastewater improvements which should lessen the operators exposures to hazardous conditions and mitigate the back up of raw sewage into homes and other infrastructure as a result of failing septic systems.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve the water system by upgrading and replacing 6,000 linear feet of aging waterline, developing a new water supply source, and constructing 6,200 lineal feet of 12-inch transmission main to connect the new source to the system. This project will also result in replacing 5,200 linear feet of asbestos cement pipe with PVC pipe, replacing 4,200 linear feet of ductile iron pipe with new PVC, and replacing water meters on individual water service lines. Rural Development funds, along with state and local funds, will support these water improvements and should help the city create a reliable and safe water supply for this rural community.

naics_industry_sector: Educational Services (61)
naics_description: ALL OTHER MISCELLANEOUS SCHOOLS AND INSTRUCTION
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Aaniiiah Nakoda College on the Fort Belknap Indian Reservation in Harlem, Montana, to purchase several pieces of equipment and fund a Preliminary Architectural Report (PER) to plan for replacement of on-campus arbor. Equipment purchases include a used pickup truck for the physical plant, a snowplow attachment, a utility vehicle to assist outdoor studies, a zero-turn mower, a multi-disciplinary star lab set up for scientific study, a plasma table and tools for the industrial trades, a medical dosing machine, and a large format printer. This investment will enhance the efficiency of operations at the college and enhance the educational experience of their more than 200 enrolled students.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to improve the wastewater treatment plant in the city of Chinook, Montana. The project will stabilize the adjacent riverbank and replace 9,900 feet of vitrified clay pipe with larger-diameter PVC sewer pipe. This will increase reliability and meet minimum DEQ sewer-pipe size standards. The project will also upgrade electrical, valves, and piping at the north lift station; replace the entire east lift station; replace six manholes in collection system areas; correct cracking and seepage in the digester wall; and other site and building features.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide funding assistance to potentially eligible micro businesses in south central Montana. The fund will be operated by the Beartooth Research Conservation and Development Area which provides economic development assistance in a five-county region of southern Montana. This project will prioritize lending in Big Horn County to assist a number of distressed communities and small businesses looking to start up secure working capital.

funding_code: DISCRETION RURAL MICROPENTERPR DEV ORG
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide technical assistance and training, by Beartooth Resource Conservation and Development (RC&D) in Joliet, Montana, to rural micro-entrepreneurs and microenterprises throughout Stillwater, Carbon, Yellowstone, Big Horn, and Sweet Grass Counties, supporting increased economic development in south central Montana, creating one new job and saving another.

funding_code: LAMP VALUE ADDED PRODUCER GRANT MANDATORY
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by Oswald Farms Inc., in Joliet, Montana, to expand the customer base and enhance profitability. This family-owned ranch in a town of 595 residents in rural Carbon County, raises grass fed beef cattle and processes it into specialty cut packaged meats, sausages, and snacks. The grant will provide working capital for processing costs, and the business is expected to expand its customer base and increase revenue during the the grant period.

program: Meat and Poultry Intermediary Lending Program (MPILP)
funding_code: MEAT & POULTRY IRP GRANTS - ARPA
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
naics_description: ADMINISTRATION OF URBAN PLANNING AND COMMUNITY AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to capitalize a second loan for the Great Falls Development Authority (GFDA). This project will increase capacity for meat and poultry processing in north central Montana. It will help existing and startup meat and poultry processing operations diversify, increase production, and process a higher percentage of livestock raised in the region. The GFDA is a regional public/private economic development partnership and certified Community Development Financial Institution.

program: Meat and Poultry Processing Expansion Program
funding_code: MEAT AND POULTRY PROCESSING GRANTS - ARPA
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: Montana Premium Processing Cooperative (MPPC), a start-up cooperative, created in partnership with the Montana Farmers Union and Farmers Union Industries, will use MPPEP funds to provide independent producers in Montana with an option for a local USDA inspected meat processing facility in an area that is currently without Federally inspected processing.

project_name: FY 23 RBDG BUTTE FOOD HUB TA
funding_code: RBCS ENTERPRISE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide additional financing to Montana Cooperative Development Center (MCDC) in Great Falls, Montana. Serving the entire state, MCDC will use USDA grant funds and matching Montana Growth thru Agriculture funds to provide technical and project planning assistance for an effective and competitive conceptual site plan. The plan will show the cooperative grocery store footprint and information relevant to the Butte Foods Co-Op, a cooperative in Silver Bow County. The project will help create 11 jobs over the next three years.

funding_code: PERSISTENT POVERTY RCDG - RURAL COOPERATIVE DEVELOPMENT GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Public Administration (92)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Montana Cooperative Development Center (MCDC) in Great Falls, Montana, to fund the Centers operational costs. The MCDC provides technical assistance to rural cooperatives and mutually owned businesses to all 56 of Montanas counties and eight sovereign Tribal nations. Through a network of economic developers, they serve as entry points to identify cooperative projects with the goal of improving conditions by supporting rural cooperatives and small businesses. Funding operational costs through this grant will save six jobs and benefit 12 individuals.

funding_code: SMALL SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED PRODUCER GRANT
naics_industry_sector: Information (51)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Montana Cooperative Development Center (MCDC) to support programming and feasibility work that will help Indigenous communities build cooperative business models and womens equity programs. MCDC, a non-profit cooperative development organization, will also work with partners to build efficiencies and best practices that extend beyond Montana borders and share these practices with other Indigenous communities.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to construct an ion exchange (IX) treatment plant to address the Town of Whitehalls uranium contaminant level violations. This funding will support a new building to house the ion exchange (IX) treatment plant, additional pipe, and replacement of the existing water tank with a new 500,000 gallon water storage tank. Located in rural Jefferson County, the Town of Whitehall is identified as an underserved area. Rural Development funding, together with other state, federal, and local funding, will help the town improve its overall water quality.

funding_code: (COMB LOAN & GRANT) WASTE DISPOSAL ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to rehabilitate 100 percent of the wastewater collection system and lift station in the town of Hobson, Montana. The project will retrofit a wet well with a new submersible pump, level controls, SCADA system, and flow measurement vault. The facultative lagoon and storage lagoon will be rehabilitated and a new HDPE liner installed in each lagoon. Additionally, new piping, valves, and control manholes will be added in the berms of the lagoons. An additional storage lagoon will be constructed, and a center pivot irrigation system will be added to apply treated effluent to crop land. This project has the potential to benefit up to 214 local residents.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by the Lake County Community Development Corporation (LCCDC) in Ronan, Montana, to provide development and operational expansion of rural cooperatives. LCCDC provides technical assistance to rural cooperatives and mutually owned businesses across Sanders, Mineral and Lake Counties in southwestern Montana, and also provides economic development services to the Confederated Salish Kootenai Tribe. This funding will assist 10 cooperatives in their efforts to improve economic conditions in southwestern Montana and will save more than 100 jobs.

funding_code: COMMUNITY FACILITY (DIRECT AND GUARANTEED LOANS)
naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to build a 45,800 square foot replacement hospital on 9.8 acres of land in White Sulphur Springs, Montana. The new Mountainview Medical Center will feature 25 inpatient beds, providing rural Meagher County residents with much-needed acute and nursing home care services. Its design features a central circulation corridor that allows for easy wayfinding, overflow patient waiting, and separate public and patient departmental access. The goal of this project is to facilitate a shift to more outpatient-oriented care, replace the outdated existing facility that has been in service for more than 70 years, and continue delivering quality care to the citizens of this rural area in Montana.

The investment will also help expand markets for agricultural commodities while utilizing practices that enhance the environment, natural resource base, and quality of life.

naics_industry_sector: Accommodation and Food Services (72)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used by Darius Investments LLC, in Butte Montana, to purchase and install a 76.14 kilowatt (kW) solar photovoltaic system for a local Days Inn. This project is expected to save $29,476 per year in energy cost and reduce power use by 100,103 kilowatt hours (kWh), enough electricity to power nine homes.

program: Rural Energy for America Technical Assistance Grant Program
funding_code: REAP IRA TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE GRANTS
naics_industry_sector: Construction (23)
naics_description: POWER AND COMMUNICATION LINE AND RELATED STRUCTURES CONSTRUCTION
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the National Center for Appropriate Technology (NCAT) in Butte, Montana, to provide direct technical assistance and outreach for REAP applicants on Native American reservations. Applicants benefit through more direct application technical assistance and awareness of REAP to improve their operational economic sustainability. NCAT works with three development organizations in Montana with the stated outcome of 20 REAP applications in distressed or disadvantaged areas, projects less than $20,000, and underutilized technologies during the two-year grant period.

funding_code: (LOAN ONLY) 1% DIRECT LOAN-WATER ONLY
naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help the city of Choteau, Montana, phase 2 water project. Construction is under way for Phase 1 and is supported by USDA RD by a $2,000,000 loan and $1,042,000 grant. Phase 2 is construction of a new storage tank to replace the 50 and 100-year-old tanks with a new 810,000-gallon glass-lined or concrete storage tank. The project will extend the water supply system to 70 residences currently with private wells, eliminating their risk of contaminated water when local flooding or sewer backup occurs.

The project will extend the water supply system to 70 residences currently with private wells, eliminating their risk of contaminated water when local flooding or sewer backup occurs.

naics_industry_sector: Utilities (22)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to make improvements to the Power-Teton County Water and Sewer District system in Power, Montana. It also will include constructing a lift station with functional pumps, controls, and backup power plus replacing iron or metal pipes.

naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
naics_description: ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES FOR THE ELDERLY
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to restore Valley View Homes lost health care revenue incurred during the COVID-19 pandemic. Valley View Home opened in Glasgow, Montana, in 1965 and serves multiple counties in northeastern Montana. It was established as a non-profit skilled nursing facility to provide elderly care and support, and over the years has expanded its services to include adding a special unit to care for Alzheimers patients and individuals suffering with traumatic brain injuries.

naics_industry_sector: Health Care and Social Assistance (62)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to provide residents of Wheatland County and the surrounding areas with access to quality health care in a modern, safe facility that is close to home. Facility planning is guided by a focus on safety, clinical excellence, exceptional patient experience, financial performance, and flexibility.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to purchase and install a 53.3 kilowatt (kW) 3-unit carport solar system in Butte, Montana, and a 58.2 kW carport solar structure and 29.1 kW roof-mounted solar system in Bozeman, Montana, for MARIC Properties LLC to assist in campground energy expenses. The project is expected to save $20,589 in annual energy costs. This will save 171,575 kilowatt-hours (kWh), approximately 47 percent of its historical utility bills or enough electricity to power 16 homes.

This will replace 100 percent of its annual energy consumption or enough electricity to power one home.

funding_code: FERTILIZER PRODUCTION EXPANSION PROGRAM
naics_industry_sector: Agriculture, Forestry, Fishing and Hunting (11)
project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to help offset the costs associated with the expansion of Town & Country Supply Associations Billings, Montana facility. The expansion includes an additional 27,700- square-foot product processing and storage facility and the construction of two railyard tracks for railcar storage to service the facility. The expansion will increase the domestic availability of urea potash, phosphate, monoammonium phosphate, and ammonium sulfate, and the project is expected to add eight jobs.

project_announced_description: This Rural Development investment will be used to install a 15 kilowatt (kW) wind turbine at Outback Wholesale in Billings, Montana. The project is expected to save this small, wholesale garage door business, which supplies parts and service throughout Yellowstone County, $4,137 in annual energy costs and reduce energy use by 23,943 kilowatt hours (kWh).
